DVSFIFOInUseException Class Reference

Public Methods

 DVSFIFOInUseException (const char *context, std::exception *e) throw ()
 DVSFIFOInUseException (const DVSFIFOInUseException &e) throw ()

Detailed Description

FIFO already in use - unable to read This exception is thrown when attempting to read or write a FIFO that is already being used.

This might occur when calling FIFO_GetFrame when a background acquisition thread is running due to an earlier call to FIFO_BackgroundGetNextFrame

Parameters:
context   Information on the context in which this exception is occurring - eg. the function call that caused it. NULL if no context string is required
e   The causal parent exception of this one being instantiated. See DVSException::DVSException()
